parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
Well, well done, good, rightly; also used as an exclamation. Neuter of a primary eus; well.
A primary word; 'good'.
And, even, also, namely.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Puny; especially neuter somewhat.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From kata and histemi; to place down, i.e. to designate, constitute, convoy.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Much, many; often.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
